intro: Cochranea chenopodiacea, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and limited water availability. Its leaves are usually reduced to scales, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Cochranea chenopodiacea plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
